data.title: default_clear_color is not used in HTML5 export
data.body:
The screen is not cleared with global variable `render/default_clear_color` when exporting to HTML5.

Previously reported in #2550

data.title: InputEventKey::is_echo() is always false in HTML5 export
data.body:
`InputEventKey::is_echo()` will always return `false` in HTML5 export.
Likewise, `InputEventKey::echo` is always `false`.
InputEventAction fired per key is affected by this as well.

data.title: Fix for smoothing camera2D when you change zoom.
data.body: Fixes #2074.

data.title: ERROR: set_current_tab: Index p_current out of size (get_tab_count()).
data.body:
From @AlexHolly:

I get this message when I open a project and go to "Scene -> open scene -> open a random scene of the project".

ERROR: set_current_tab: Index p_current out of size (get_tab_count()).
At: scene/gui/tabs.cpp:501.
settings changed

master branch
Ubuntu 14.04

data.title: Sample will not loop in HTML5 export
data.body: A sample set to `SAMPLE_LOOP_PING_PONG` or `SAMPLE_LOOP_FORWARD` will not loop at all when played per any SamplePlayer.

data.title: Input events for most keys have scancode 0 in HTML5 export
data.body:
The affected keys will fire an InputEventKey event, but scancode is given as 0.
The same keys will also not be recognized by the Input singleton, nor will actions be fired by them.
This occurs with most keys, exceptions are:
-  Space, Insert
-  Up, Down, Left, Right
-  Home, End, PageUp/Down
-  F1-F12

Previously reported in #2550

data.title: Physics2D collision query fails
data.body:
This issue are actually multiple related issues combined. A very tough nut for me to crack, but it got me into looking at the godot source, so I guess that's a good thing. But I'm stuck, so please help me out a bit.

Anyway, in an [example project](http://cutpi.com/jlm), I created a scene containing two instances of KinematicBody2D which overlap. Both bodies are on layer 1, but without a mask. That's why they do not affect each other.

In the [scene script](https://gist.github.com/ZuBsPaCe/f0832c1989b570c61764) I'm using Physics2DDirectSpaceState.intersect_shape(query) to determine, if both bodies overlap. In the query I am setting the layer mask to 1, but I do not get any results, which is wrong.

This appeared to me in a project created in godot 1.1, where everything worked fine. This bug was introduced somewhere around the 26/27 Mai (See commit [9df77d2](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/9df77d2) and following) after introducing threaded physics. I figured out, that this bug only happens, if the project property "physics_2d/thread_model" is set to Single-Safe or Multi-Threaded. Single-Unsafe works fine.

**What worries me is, that Single-Safe is the new default for new and existing projects.** So everyone using such queries will be affected. By looking at the code I believe, that collide_shape, cast_motion and rest_info are affected, too. I could provide a pull request if you like, but I'm not sure if I'm the right person for this job, maybe @reduz could take a look first? 

**It is also questionable, that Single-Safe is the default setting.** Does this provide any benefit compared to Single-Unsafe?

**Additionally, there's a problem running the example project with thread_model Multi-Threaded**. I'm running into AccessViolations within hash_map.get_entry, but not on every start. Maybe 1 out of 4 starts, so you need to try multiple times. The 2D demo 'dynamic collision shapes' (the one with the yellow balls falling) is also affected when run as Multi-Threaded and crashes after a few seconds. I tried to debug this, but I have no clue where to look. Probably one thread is moving/removing stuff which another one needs to access, but this is just a guess. I hope, that maybe someone else could take a look.

(Edit: Updated Example Project link.)

data.title: Don't require and store Android release keystore passphrase in plaintext
data.body:
Alpha 2.0

I'd like to have the option to not specify the keystore passphrase and be prompted for it only when I export a release APK.
Godot should not store the passphrase in plaintext (or at all).

data.title: Web export fails when running in <iframe> and third-party cookies are disabled
data.body:
[itch.io](https://itch.io) is a website that enables developers to upload, present and sell their games. The site also allows upload of HTML5 games, which are embedded in an `iframe` on the game's page. For some more information see here: http://itch.io/docs/creators/html5.

Currently, games exported to HTML5 from Godot will not start on itch.io. The only unusual error message given by the embedded output is:

```
Assertion failed: undefined
```

Chrome's console gives this additional trace:

```
Assertion failed: undefined
    Module.printErr @ index.html:1246
Uncaught abort("Assertion failed: undefined") at Error
    at jsStackTrace (http://commondatastorage.googleapis.com/itchio/html/119893/index.js:1:20729)
    at stackTrace (http://commondatastorage.googleapis.com/itchio/html/119893/index.js:1:20912)
    at abort (http://commondatastorage.googleapis.com/itchio/html/119893/index.js:30:11012)
    at assert (http://commondatastorage.googleapis.com/itchio/html/119893/index.js:1:6960)
    at http://commondatastorage.googleapis.com/itchio/html/119893/index.js:1:27634
    at done (http://commondatastorage.googleapis.com/itchio/html/119893/index.js:1:87664)
    at http://commondatastorage.googleapis.com/itchio/html/119893/index.js:1:66679
    at http://commondatastorage.googleapis.com/itchio/html/119893/index.js:1:68182
    at IDBOpenDBRequest.IDBFS.getDB.req.onerror (http://commondatastorage.googleapis.com/itchio/html/119893/index.js:1:67461)
If this abort() is unexpected, build with -s ASSERTIONS=1 which can give more information.
```

This occurs with both debug and release builds.
The same exported files will work when uploaded to Google Drive.
This example uses the official nightly debug build from 2015-10-30:
http://eska.itch.io/godot-engine-test?secret=tMDcL7SiZSh0Qo98RHCk4yLnDRk

data.title: Scrolling Control nodes don't display correctly when under a Render Target viewport
data.body:
I'm still using 1.1 but I tested this in a recent release of 2.0 and it was still an issue.

When using a Render Target viewport (such as when using `stretch_mode`, `viewport`) I've found that ScrollContainer nodes and RichTextLabel nodes have some offset not behaving or something. (There might be other types that have this issue, these are the ones I've found). I'll try to illustrate...

I put a few Control nodes under a Render Target viewport and few above it and this is what it SHOULD look like
![howitshouldlook](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15483613/11039252/5302dbee-86cc-11e5-804b-e88e515e5411.png)

However this is what it does instead
![output](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15483613/11039034/729ed33c-86cb-11e5-9d0d-427f6353399f.png)

The white/black squares are texture frames and are working correctly. The white ones are children of the Render Target viewport and the black ones are not but they just show that they line up as intended.

The red box, the green box with the gradient, and the second (not visible) RichTextLabel are all children of a Render Target viewport, the  blue box, the first box with the image of the gradient, and the first RichTextLabel are not. In fact, here's what the scene looks like...
![scene](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15483613/11039466/6f5768fe-86cd-11e5-97a7-f00e67a43990.png)

I actually just used a big `draw_rect` to locate the wandering nodes. At first it appeared as though the nodes just weren't showing up at all.

Also worth mentioning that I forgot to show is that the boxes move when the window is resized. If the window is resized just a little they'll move down a little more. They move out of the window entirely before it's even twice as tall. And it's just like... the clipping rectangle that moves. For example, in the green box with the gradient image, the image and scroll bar will stay where they are, the visible area will just move so that it shows less and less of them.

data.title: UDP fixes
data.body:
Fixed a couple of issues with PacketPeerUDP:
- recvfrom was getting wrong buffer sizes causing disconnects.
- recvfrom could get wrong buffer sizes due to signed<->unsigned conversion.
- disconnects were caused by WSAECONNRESET-error, which normally should be ignored (the udp chat example is difficult to try on Windows due to this). I did not do anything in the posix implementation with this, as I'm not sure if it's an issue there - not able to test right now.

data.title: Add Metadata (or set an script) to Tileset Tiles to determine behaviour on contact with specific tiles (grates, oneway platforms, vertical stairs, grass, etc)
data.body:
Example: when in tileset setup scene and creating a tile StaticBody2D or KinematicBody2D, be able to set an script and set something like:

``` GDScript
# grate.gd
# this is the Tile
extends KinematicBody2D
func _ready():
     set_meta("tile_type", "grate")
```

This way in the character collision event when can so something like this:

``` GDScript
# player.gd
extends KinematicBody2D
func _fixed_process(delta):
     if(is_colliding()):
          if(get_collider().has_meta("tile_type")):
               if(get_collider().get_meta("tile_type") == "grate"):
                    print("you can go through if your character has acquired a mist form")
               if(get_collider().get_meta("tile_type") == "dropdown"):
                    print("you can drop down if you press down+jump")
               if(get_collider().get_meta("tile_type") == "verticalstair"):
                    print("you can climb up if you press up")
               if(get_collider().get_meta("tile_type") == "grass"):
                    print("you can play the sound of walking on grass")

```

Right now this can be done with a separated KinematicBody2D on the scene, but it would be simpler to define this just one time on the Tileset scene and then be reusable as a tile instead of creating many separated objects on the scene and setting each one of them as something different, like a grate, platforms that you can dropdown from, vertical stairs, foolr types to play a different walking sound, etc...

Thanks in advance
Regards

data.title: New shader feature: change the colour of shadows on a per-material basis
data.body: This is another tiny extension to the pre-existing custom shader system to allow for setting the colour of shadows per-material. I'm using this because I'm working on some NPR shaders and was able to get much better results having this more fine-grained control of shadowing.

data.title: Parallax layers preview in 2D viewport (Editor)
data.body:
It is useful to preview parallax layers in 2d viewport of editor, like this:
![tww_parallax_scrolling_sample_2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14325605/11016133/c75475b6-858c-11e5-8c06-72b15130dd5e.jpg)
![tww_parallax_scrolling_sample_1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14325605/11016134/c76ffb9c-858c-11e5-8c3c-82ae108f545c.jpg)

It makes editing current 3d in 2d feature easier, doesn't it? In extension can be used for isometric scenes preview in editor. 
I tried to show the concepts in above images. My intended purpose isn't a fake(like Ubiart framework) 2d game in 3d viewport. but here is some videos:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uWF9NjsTWtc
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y-chi097uV4

How much works (code) it takes?

data.title: Bookmarks to switch scenes and code lines
data.body:
It can be useful to define bookmarks .
For example, clicking right mouse button on the line number (in code editor) may display a context menu to toggle a bookmark on that line (and maybe breakpoint)
Then have buttons that allow you to move to the point where was defined next or previous bookmark .
Bookmarks can be placed also on the scene, so you can switch to different scenes or points of different code using bookmarks.
I hope I have made it clear what I mean.

data.title: Settings tab to redefine hotkeys
data.body:
It could be useful to redefine hotkeys . 
For example, usually I use F3 to repeat the last search. 
While pressing F3 in code editor, it opens the 3D view, I'd like to redefine this hotkey and possibly others e.g. Ctrl+A

data.title: Opus driver -> build problems with msvc2010 command line (scons)
data.body:
opus driver
it seems this driver breaks the build on msvc 2010, after disabling it, i could build again (sorry was my first compile so i may be wrong), first i got

**"__restricted errors"**
was solved by removing 

``` C
"#define restrict __restrict"
```

in opus_config.h
never use restrict use RESTRICT ? :) (btw i think its evalueted correctly in nedmalloc.h)
after that i run into

**"_LRINTF" and "_LRINT" linker errors**
even when i changed to :

``` c
/* Define to 1 if you have the lrint' function. */ 
#define HAVE_LRINT 0 
/* Define to 1 if you have thelrintf' function. */
#define HAVE_LRINTF 0
```

then i disabled it :)

data.title: Particle effects (3D) in a viewport blend to black.
data.body:
Particle effects (3D) in a viewport with transparent background blend to black. This may just be the way it works but it looks ugly. It would be better if the particles blended with the colour of the pixels behind them instead. 
Screenshot of a viewport with particles and another viewport behind it:

![viewportparticlebug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15687516/10996174/e550db96-8482-11e5-82a2-02cf39f9291b.jpg)

data.title: Camera with Environment gets smeared on the right side
data.body:
If a viewport camera has an environment attached the result is a smearing of the right side of the image.

![camera_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15687516/10995980/4976e3d8-8481-11e5-8466-e6e209c06b0a.jpg)

```
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneOS.platform/Developer/SDKs/iPhoneOS.sdk//usr/include/c++/4.2.1/bits/cpp_type_traits.h:161:12: note: previous definition is here
     struct __is_integer<bool>
            ^
fatal error: too many errors emitted, stopping now [-ferror-limit=]
20 errors generated.
scons: *** [platform/iphone/game_center.iphone.debug.o] Error 1
scons: building terminated because of errors.
```

data.title: extend code selection using only mouse in code editor
data.body:
I don't known if it is a feature required or a bug.
But using mouse it is possible to select only the visible portion of code.
It is useful extend selection and scrolling when mouse it is near the upper or lower border and the left mouse button it is pressed.

data.title: Ray Casts need something opposite to exceptions.
data.body:
For now RayCast Node and raycast API for Camera Node can only accept exceptions which they omit when they are doing collision check.
It would be greatly useful to have there something opposite for this behaviour as well.

For example you want ray cast to find specified object or group of object ignoring the rest of the world full of potential colliders.

For now only way I found to do it, is using get_tree().get_nodes_in_group() to find objects that I want to ignore. Or by creating global array of objects I want to ignore for ray cast, that will add themselves to this array when instance is created.

data.title: Display error type (error, warning, script error) in OS::print_error + cleanup error ANSI coloring
data.body:
**tl;dr:** In the end, it looks like this:
- _Dark background colour:_
  ![gt-colour1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/11056936/1560544a-8787-11e5-80b8-b4aa6f7c56ff.jpg)
- _Light background colour:_
  ![gt-colour2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/11056937/17db05da-8787-11e5-8d4c-5ded24b2b4c9.jpg)

---

Previously all types of errors would be shown as ERROR, thus making for example warnings (WARN_PRINT) somewhat aggressive.

Fixes #1127.

Note that I'm a beginner C++ developer, so the coding logic I adopted might not be the best one. I also only tested the changes on Unix/X11, so the changes for Windows and WinRT need to be thoroughly reviewed (though they're more or less copy-pastes of the Unix code).
